comment_data.body: Please keep `tree` as the last parameter. It acts as an “inout” parameter, its position at the end of the argument list is intentional.

 ---                       function, it accepts the buffer number of the source
 ---                       buffer as its only argument and should return a string.
+--- @field include_root boolean? Include the root nodes in the tree.

comment_data.body:
Let's not add extra knobs and configurations here. Just make it the default and not configurable.

One feature we could add in the future is the ability to "reparent" the tree at any node. So with the tree view open you press a key on any node, and a new tree view is opened that shows only nodes that are children of the node that the key was pressed on. If we had such a feature, then users could use that on the top-level root node to hide it, if they really don't want to see it.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -42,11 +42,32 @@ local TSTreeView = {}
 ---@param lang string Language of the tree currently being traversed
 ---@param injections table<string, TSP.Injection> Mapping of node ids to root nodes
 ---                  of injected language trees (see explanation above)
+---@param include_root boolean Whether to include the root nodes in the tree

comment_data.body: ~~injection: `depth` or `depth + 1`?~~ NVM, in this implementation `depth + 1` is correct.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -44,9 +44,25 @@ local TSTreeView = {}
 ---                  of injected language trees (see explanation above)
 ---@param tree TSP.Node[] Output table containing a list of tables each representing a node in the tree
 local function traverse(node, depth, lang, injections, tree)
+  if depth == 0 then
+    table.insert(tree, {
+      node = node,
+      depth = depth,
+      lang = lang,
+    })
+
+    depth = depth + 1
+  end
+
   local injection = injections[node:id()]
   if injection then
-    traverse(injection.root, depth, injection.lang, injections, tree)
+    table.insert(tree, {
+      node = injection.root,
+      depth = depth,
+      lang = injection.lang,
+    })
+
+    traverse(injection.root, depth + 1, injection.lang, injections, tree)

comment_data.body: If we want to go a little bit further, though not mandatory: now that we want to include the root node, this implementation could be simplified by unifying all the three `table.insert(tree, { ... })` statements into just one call here. This traverse function should have additional argument `field` though.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -44,9 +44,25 @@ local TSTreeView = {}
 ---                  of injected language trees (see explanation above)
 ---@param tree TSP.Node[] Output table containing a list of tables each representing a node in the tree
 local function traverse(node, depth, lang, injections, tree)
+  if depth == 0 then
+    table.insert(tree, {
+      node = node,
+      depth = depth,
+      lang = lang,
+    })

@@ -42,11 +42,32 @@ local TSTreeView = {}
 ---@param lang string Language of the tree currently being traversed
 ---@param injections table<string, TSP.Injection> Mapping of node ids to root nodes
 ---                  of injected language trees (see explanation above)
+---@param include_root boolean Whether to include the root nodes in the tree

comment_data.body:
I'm really sorry to be picky here, but it would be even better if we can move the parameter `field` before `lang` (e.g. next to `depth`), because:

- `node`, `depth`, and `field` are the parameters that represent the current context of the *node* being visited
- `injections` and `tree` are for the bigger context (*tree*)
- and this is a local function, so signature change is fine.
comment_data.diff_hunk:

+---@param field string|nil The field of the current node
 ---@param tree TSP.Node[] Output table containing a list of tables each representing a node in the tree
-local function traverse(node, depth, lang, injections, tree)
+local function traverse(node, depth, lang, injections, field, tree)

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
    traverse(injection.root, depth + 1, injection.lang, injections, nil, tree)
```

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -42,22 +42,24 @@ local TSTreeView = {}
 ---@param lang string Language of the tree currently being traversed
 ---@param injections table<string, TSP.Injection> Mapping of node ids to root nodes
 ---                  of injected language trees (see explanation above)
+---@param field string|nil The field of the current node
 ---@param tree TSP.Node[] Output table containing a list of tables each representing a node in the tree
-local function traverse(node, depth, lang, injections, tree)
+local function traverse(node, depth, lang, injections, field, tree)
+  table.insert(tree, {
+    node = node,
+    depth = depth,
+    lang = lang,
+    field = field,

-    traverse(injection.root, depth, injection.lang, injections, tree)

-  for child, field in node:iter_children() do

-      depth = depth,
-      lang = lang,
-    })
-
-    traverse(child, depth + 1, lang, injections, tree)
+  for child, child_field in node:iter_children() do
+    traverse(child, depth, lang, injections, child_field, tree)

comment_regular_data.body: One question. Should it also consider to add root nodes to injected trees?
My mistake, didn't see it's already done :+1:

I rewrote test cases for `InspectTree` in #27295. Once it gets merged, please rebase to it so we can write test cases more easily.

Also questions:

- Do we want to make it toggleable? If so, what key would we want? `r` or `R` might conflict with #27295.
- Lua API (opts table) exists but how can we enable this option via commands?

>     * Do we want to make it toggleable?

No, this can just be the default behavior. The indent in the tree view is small enough that one extra level is not a big deal.

I was planning to write tests afterwards, but merging #27295 first (and write relevant tests here) sounds also fine to me. I will leave to @altermo touching the test cases once #27295 is merged, thanks in advance!
